revised_title: On the Appearance of Bright Lines in the Spectra of Irresolvable Star-Clusters
tldr: The author discusses the appearance of bright lines in the spectra of irresolvable star-clusters and explains that the irresolvability of these clusters is connected to the light from the gaseous envelopes becoming proportional to that from the stellar masses. This phenomenon is observed in nebulae like Orion and v Argus, and the author believes that more facts will support this hypothesis.
